title: The broken Raking system at the end of a game

embed.description: Imgur: The most awesome images on the Internet.

body:
alright guys here's what's up

I have recently finished a game as Fiora which I performed very well at least in my opinion, I made the enemy surrender because how fed I am and I thought to myself, I can finally get the mastery 6 token I need, and once the result screen came up I saw I got an A.

I feel like it is very unfair because I performed very very well, and I don't get games like this very often, but I don't have an S for getting perfect KDA? pardon my language, but I really think it's bull shit.

I don't mean to be rude, but I wish someone at riot can give an explanation.

replies.body: The simple answer you seek: They surrendered. The game was not full length.
you can go 7/10/12 and get 300 CS for an S-

things that make up grades:

- k/d/a
- cs/minute
- wards placed/enemy wards destroyed
- participation in killing dragons
- participation in destroying turrets
- participation in taking rift herald and baron

i might have missed other stats. stats like healing and damage mitigated in general might factor into grades aswell.

all these stats of yours are compared to the average stats of how other people performed with your champion at your level of play.

if you  dont get an S for hard carrying a game at your rating with a certain champion, then its because this is a common occurance with that champion. you did better than average. hence you got an A.

but it wasnt one of the best prformances comparitively.

Yeah there's a lot of different things that go into determining your grade at the end of a game. 
- There's the obvious KDA. But what people don't realize a lot of times is that it compares you ( at least I'm pretty sure) to the average KDA of that specific champion. So I could still have a 3-0-12 score with sona. But if the average KDA is 6-0-14, it's not going to matter as much.
RoguePanda is also correct in that farm counts as well. In this case you needed a higher farm. Not because your farm was actually bad for the time limit; but again, because of that champion average. 


Unless I'm completely wrong, but this is what I've gathered. Sorry you got jipped. I paid RP for a hextech chest and got a ward skin I already owned. GG
it's probably because your farm was trash. Cs is weighed pretty heavily in determining that rating.
